column3: Good Practice
Create a cookie banner. Include a title and a button to accept or decline the storage and usage of cookies. Use same color for buttons

column3: Design an ads personalization settings page with a brief note, a toggle for personalized ads, and a confirmation message. Keep it simple and user-friendly.
column6: 1. Figma Make features: Auto Layout: to structure text, radio buttons, and confirmation buttons neatly. Components & Variants: for radio buttons orcheckboxes (selected/unselected). Prototyping: to simulate the unsubscribe confirmation flow. Text & Color Styles: for clear hierarchy and brandingconsistency. 2. Prompts to use: ¡°Design a clean unsubscribe page for a website with an option to stop receiving marketing emails.¡± ¡°Include a shortthank-you or feedback message, and a visible ¡®Unsubscribe¡¯ button.¡± ¡°Use a simple layout with friendly wording and brand colors.¡± 3. User interaction:Users click ¡°Unsubscribe¡± link in an email ¡ú page opens showing their email address and message (¡°We¡¯re sorry to see you go. Would you like tounsubscribe from all newsletters?¡±) ¡ú user selects ¡®Yes, unsubscribe me¡¯ ¡ú clicks ¡®Confirm Unsubscribe¡¯ ¡ú success message appears (¡°You have beenunsubscribed. You¡¯ll no longer receive marketing emails.¡±) ¡ú optional ¡®Resubscribe¡¯ link displayed.

column3: help design a clean webbsite layout that features an unsubscribe page with two toggle buttons, one for "Subscribe" when checked and the other for "Unsubscribe". And after a user check on either of the two toggles, it should show a brief explanation and confirmation message. And remember to make the ui user friendly
column6: Create a page for unsubscribing. Maintain a simple modern design. Use a hyperlink with the unsubscribe title

column3: Kindly design a web layout which would primarily be an Unsubscribe page and there will be an option for user after coming there to either opt in or out of receiving marketing emails, this should only be done based on their preference. Keep it simple and easy to navigate. Help regenerate the layout to assuage user's doubt that they are not subscribed to receiving the marketing email initially not unless they plan on doing so themselves
column6: Help design a user access request feature for a website where users can request and receive a copy of their personal data collected by the site. Include a button labelled "Request my data" and a short explanation of what data will be shared, and a simple confirmation form and success message after submission. and ensure to keep the layout really clean and user friendly

column3: Could you help design an unsubscribe page for a website where users can easily opt out of newsletters or marketing emails? Include a clear¡°Unsubscribe¡± button, a short explanation, and a confirmation message after completion.
Design a simple button for unsubscribe. Keep it clear and privacy-first.

Design a privacy consent interface for a website. It should be at the homepage of the website. It should attach a link to the privacy form and below it,acheckbox for confirming consent. On the bottom should be a continue button which appears only after confirmation

Design a user data access request flow for a mobile app's privacy settings. This function allows users to request a copy of all their personal data. Use aclean, trustworthy design with a neutral color scheme. Include clear status indicators and manage user expectations about the processing time. The toneshould be transparent and helpful.
